content: Glad to see that the reverse ticket system is catching on.

I noticed that the CI is not automatically moving tasks from the unclaimed to claimed column. I think the mistake might be in the label. The correct label was project-task in the ETP. The place to check this is .github/workflows/01-claim-issues.yml .
CI is a bit mysterious to me. If you know how to change it to task in .github.workflows/01-claim-issues.yml, can you make a PR?

Shreyas Srinivas said:

I noticed that the CI is not automatically moving tasks from the unclaimed to claimed column.

This isn't true, see https://github.com/thefundamentaltheor3m/Sphere-Packing-Lean/issues/72
@Bhavik Mehta I am looking at the other two tasks
Sidharth seems to have had to move them manually
No, neither of these were moved manually, these are the workflows acting on Sid's behalf.
That particular one broke for other reasons :) You can check this for yourself by looking at the workflow files

Shreyas, we live in a temporal paradigm where there is a clear distinction between present and past. The fact that things were broken at one point does not mean they are broken now. If you really want to test out the workflows, which we have done several times, instead of making spurious references to workflow files without any explanation, why don’t you try actually claiming an issue for yourself and making a worthwhile contribution to this project? Or, if you still insist that the workflows are wrong, why don’t you make a PR with a fix? Just know that we do expect those who claim issues/make PRs to actually work on them, and that we will be very strict in reallocating/closing them if we feel like the underlying motivations are insincere.

I don’t see the need for an aggressive response here. I happen to know how this particular system works rather well, and spotted an issue that I have debugged in the past and therefore offered to help. When I first raised this issue, it was less than 8 hours old.
I am sorry if that was unwelcome
Sidharth Hariharan has marked this topic as resolved.
